ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Definitely made me a better writer
Improving how to write papers and transferring from high school to college.
The course really challenged me to go outside my comfort box and also helped me become a better writer.
I gained critical thinking skills, I learned how to articulate my thoughts, and I enjoyed having meaningful discussions.
My writing was vastly improved through this course. I learned to be able to focus on my theme and clearly communicate my ideas.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The grading scale made it harder to get an A compared to normal percentage letter conversions, but easier to get a C instead of a D by percentGes, more clarification on what we should change between paper drafts would be appreciated as well, it's frustrating to receive no comments on a particular section of a rough draft and then get marked down for not changing it in the final draft. I liked when we had class outside and daily checkins.

One strength was that we were able to do multiple revisions on our papers so we were able to learn from our mistakes and gain feedback from many people. Another strength was that the small class size enabled us to have good discussions were everyone could contribute. One weakness was that we would start reading articles for the next paper before finishing and turning in the previous paper.
I like that the class size is so small, it gives everyone a chance to speak and learn from one another.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It's a good class for improving your writing abilities, I think everyone should take this or something similar. It is gonna be a decent amount of work, however.
This is a fun class and the readings are interesting. I learned to improve my writing and focus on the details. I also learned how to effectively articulate my thoughts and express them on paper.
Yes, I was able to expand my ideas on beauty and social conceptions and work on my writing skills at the same time.
